magpie.optimization.rankers

Class BaseEntryRanker

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.optimization.rankers.BaseEntryRanker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Options
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassProbabilityRanker, CompositionDistanceRanker, MultiObjectiveEntryRanker, SimpleEntryRanker, TargetEntryRanker

    public abstract class BaseEntryRanker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Options
    This is a template for classes that rank entries based on some sort of objective function. When implementing this class, you only need to provide the objective function. The final user must decide whether it uses measured or predicted data and whether the goal is to maximize or minimize the objective function.

    Implementation Guide

    Only two operations and the Options interface need to be defined:

    1. objectiveFunction(magpie.data.BaseEntry): Compute the value of an objective function based on an entry. This value is used to sort entries.
    2. train(magpie.data.Dataset): Perform any operations required before running the objective function. Not always necessary.

      • objectiveFunction

        public abstract double objectiveFunction(BaseEntry Entry)
        Some kind of objective function that returns a double when given an entry.

        NOTE: This function needs to support using either the measured or predicted class depending on the settings

        Parameters:
        Entry - Entry to be analyzed
        Returns:
        Evaluation of target function

      • rankEntries

        public int[] rankEntries(Dataset Data,
                double[] Values)
        Return the rank of entries that were sorted based on the objective function defined in this class (also depends on the settings for Maximize and Measured. Will return the values for each instance (sorted in the same order as the output, which require preallocating Values.

        double[] Values = new double[Data.NEntries()];
        Parameters:
        Data - Dataset containing entries to be ranked
        Values - Pre-allocated, containing Data.NEntries() number of entries
        Returns:
        Entry number ranked by objective function

        Evaluate every entry in a dataset using the objective function
        Parameters:
        Data - Dataset to be evaluated
        Returns:
        Value of objective function for each entry

        Returns:
